Class ec.ez.prim.EZUniversal 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ez.prim.EZUniversal
public class EZUniversal
extends Object
A sweetener defining extra messages that may be e-sent to any object.

order(Object, String, Object[], Resolver)
Why, you may think, do we still need an order() message when we've got poEZ? With this order message, if the first message throws a non-Ejection, then the successor messages are not delivered.
perform(Object, String, Object[])
when(Object, Object)
used for the equivalent of an ewhen closure

perform 
 public static Object perform(Object rec,
                              String verb,
                              Object args[]) throws Exception, Ejection
when 
 public static void when(Object rec,
                         Object resolutionNoticer)
used for the equivalent of an ewhen closure

order 
 public static Object order(Object rec,
                            String nestedVerb,
                            Object nestedArgs[],
                            Resolver after) throws Exception, Ejection
Why, you may think, do we still need an order() message when we've got poEZ? With this order message, if the first message throws a non-Ejection, then the successor messages are not delivered. Instead of being forwarded, the 'after' Resolver is smashed with the first message's problem.
